title: K. Sabeel Rahman
text:
K. Sabeel Rahman is an American legal scholar, author, and policy advisor who currently serves as Senior Counselor in the <a href="Office%20of%20Information%20and%20Regulatory%20Affairs">Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA)</a> in the <a href="Biden%20administration">Biden administration</a>. He joined the Biden Administration from <a href="Demos%20%28U.S.%20think%20tank%29">Demos</a>, a <a href="Liberalism%20in%20the%20United%20States">liberal</a> <a href="think%20tank">think tank</a> he served as president of from 2018 to 2021.
Education.
Rahman studied at <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a>, where he received his <a href="bachelor%27s%20degree">bachelor's degree</a> (B.A.), <a href="Juris%20Doctor">Juris Doctor</a>ate (J.D.), and <a href="Doctor%20of%20Philosophy">Ph.D</a> degree in <a href="Political%20philosophy">political theory</a>. Additionally, he attended the <a href="University%20of%20Oxford">University of Oxford</a> as a <a href="Rhodes%20Scholar">Rhodes Scholar</a>, where he studied both law and economic development.
Career.
During his career, he has held fellowships at both <a href="New%20America%20%28organization%29">New America</a> and the <a href="Roosevelt%20Institute">Roosevelt Institute</a>, and notably served as co-chair of the <a href="Law%20and%20Political%20Economy%20Project">Law and Political Economy (LPE) Project</a>. Rahman once served as an analyst within OIRA during the <a href="Presidency%20of%20Barack%20Obama">Obama Administration</a>, and would return to the office as a Senior Counselor under President <a href="Joe%20Biden">Joe Biden</a>. In <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>, he served as a special advisor for economic development from 2014 to 2015 and has also served on the city's Rent Guidelines Board.
Rahman served as an Associate Professor of Law at <a href="Brooklyn%20Law%20School">Brooklyn Law School</a> from 2015 to 2019, and is currently on leave from the institution. The bulk of Rahman's work has focused on <a href="regulatory%20state">regulatory</a> and administrative law, taking a <a href="Neorepublicanism">neorepublican</a> perspective on power and <a href="participatory%20democracy">participatory democracy</a> inspired by the work of <a href="John%20Dewey">John Dewey</a> and <a href="Louis%20Brandeis">Louis Brandeis</a>.
